It is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, delicate flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cryptolappa triphylla is considered a vulnerable species.
